20101221020058.000|20101221020100.000|TR0|
20101221020100.000|20101221020103.000|TR0|KING:  It's a great pleasure to welcome 
20101221020103.000|20101221020105.000|TR0|back to LARRY KING LIVE a good friend.  
20101221020105.000|20101221020107.000|TR0|We've got a month to go with this show and 
20101221020107.000|20101221020110.000|TR0|I'm so honored to have him kick off this 
20101221020110.000|20101221020112.000|TR0|week.
20101221020112.000|20101221020114.000|TR0|
20101221020114.000|20101221020117.000|TR0|General Colin Powell, United States Army, 
20101221020117.000|20101221020119.000|TR0|retired.  He was secretary of State under 
20101221020119.000|20101221020121.000|TR0|President George W. Bush.  He was former 
20101221020121.000|20101221020124.000|TR0|chairman of the Joint Chiefs, founder and 
20101221020124.000|20101221020126.000|TR0|chair of the Colin Powell Center in Harlem.
20101221020126.000|20101221020128.000|TR0|
20101221020128.000|20101221020131.000|TR0|I'm going to visit that center next month. 
20101221020131.000|20101221020133.000|TR0| That's a center for policy studies 
20101221020133.000|20101221020135.000|TR0|affiliated with the City College of New 
20101221020135.000|20101221020138.000|TR0|York.
20101221020138.000|20101221020140.000|TR0|
20101221020140.000|20101221020142.000|TR0|And he's the founding chairman of 
20101221020142.000|20101221020145.000|TR0|America's Promise.
20101221020145.000|20101221020147.000|TR0|
20101221020147.000|20101221020149.000|TR0|It was six years ago today that Colin 
20101221020149.000|20101221020152.000|TR0|Powell announced he was resigning as 
20101221020152.000|20101221020154.000|TR0|secretary of State.
20101221020154.000|20101221020156.000|TR0|
20101221020156.000|20101221020159.000|TR0|Boy, time goes.
20101221020159.000|20101221020201.000|TR0|
20101221020201.000|20101221020203.000|TR0|POWELL:  Time goes.  Yes.
20101221020203.000|20101221020206.000|TR0|
20101221020206.000|20101221020208.000|TR0|KING:  Do you miss government?
20101221020208.000|20101221020210.000|TR0|
20101221020210.000|20101221020213.000|TR0|POWELL:  Not really.  I try not to miss 
20101221020213.000|20101221020215.000|TR0|anything in life.  I enjoyed my government 
20101221020215.000|20101221020217.000|TR0|service.  I was in government service for 
20101221020217.000|20101221020220.000|TR0|40 years, between the military and the 
20101221020220.000|20101221020222.000|TR0|State Department.
20101221020222.000|20101221020224.000|TR0|
20101221020224.000|20101221020227.000|TR0|But I always like to look forward.  As I 
20101221020227.000|20101221020229.000|TR0|say to so many audiences, you always 
20101221020229.000|20101221020231.000|TR0|should go through life looking through the 
20101221020231.000|20101221020234.000|TR0|front of the windshield, not the rearview 
20101221020234.000|20101221020236.000|TR0|mirror.  So I'm always looking for 
20101221020236.000|20101221020238.000|TR0|something new and exciting.
20101221020238.000|20101221020241.000|TR0|
20101221020241.000|20101221020243.000|TR0|KING:  You're always a general, though, 
20101221020243.000|20101221020245.000|TR0|right?  The correct -- the correct title, 
20101221020245.000|20101221020248.000|TR0|once a general, always a general.
20101221020248.000|20101221020250.000|TR0|
20101221020250.000|20101221020252.000|TR0|POWELL:  The protocol is general, Larry.  
20101221020252.000|20101221020255.000|TR0|I'm a former secretary, but I'd rather be 
20101221020255.000|20101221020257.000|TR0|a general rather than a former secretary.
20101221020257.000|20101221020259.000|TR0|
20101221020259.000|20101221020302.000|TR0|KING:  Of all the jobs you've had, what do 
20101221020302.000|20101221020304.000|TR0|you miss the most? You don't think about 
20101221020304.000|20101221020306.000|TR0|it, but which was --
20101221020306.000|20101221020309.000|TR0|
20101221020309.000|20101221020311.000|TR0|POWELL:  In the 40 years of service that I 
20101221020311.000|20101221020313.000|TR0|had, what I miss the most is just being 
20101221020313.000|20101221020316.000|TR0|with fellow servicepersons, people who 
20101221020316.000|20101221020318.000|TR0|were GIs or diplomats or foreign 
20101221020318.000|20101221020320.000|TR0|specialists.  I miss working with people.
20101221020320.000|20101221020323.000|TR0|
20101221020323.000|20101221020325.000|TR0|The tension, the pressure, the challenges 
20101221020325.000|20101221020327.000|TR0|-- that was an important part of all of 
20101221020327.000|20101221020330.000|TR0|those assignments.  Being in combat, the 
20101221020330.000|20101221020332.000|TR0|peacetime service, all of that was 
20101221020332.000|20101221020334.000|TR0|important.  But the thing you miss the 
20101221020334.000|20101221020337.000|TR0|most late at night, the thing you reflect 
20101221020337.000|20101221020339.000|TR0|on are the people that you were privileged 
20101221020339.000|20101221020341.000|TR0|to serve with.
20101221020341.000|20101221020344.000|TR0|
20101221020344.000|20101221020346.000|TR0|KING:  All right, let's get right into it. 
20101221020346.000|20101221020348.000|TR0| You endorsed the president, Mr. Obama, 
20101221020348.000|20101221020351.000|TR0|for president.  Two years in.  Any second 
20101221020351.000|20101221020353.000|TR0|thoughts?
20101221020353.000|20101221020355.000|TR0|
20101221020355.000|20101221020358.000|TR0|POWELL:  None whatsoever.  When I endorsed 
20101221020358.000|20101221020400.000|TR0|then Senator Obama in 2008, I thought he 
20101221020400.000|20101221020402.000|TR0|was the right choice for the country.  The 
20101221020402.000|20101221020405.000|TR0|country was in deep economic despair.  I 
20101221020405.000|20101221020407.000|TR0|think the country needed a significant and 
20101221020407.000|20101221020409.000|TR0|transformational change and I thought 
20101221020409.000|20101221020412.000|TR0|President Obama would provide that for us. 
20101221020412.000|20101221020414.000|TR0| It was hard --
20101221020414.000|20101221020416.000|TR0|
20101221020416.000|20101221020419.000|TR0|KING:  Disappointing at all?
20101221020419.000|20101221020421.000|TR0|
20101221020421.000|20101221020423.000|TR0|POWELL:  No, well, let me -- I'll get to 
20101221020423.000|20101221020426.000|TR0|that.  It was -- it was a hard decision 
20101221020426.000|20101221020428.000|TR0|for me because I was so close to Senator 
20101221020428.000|20101221020430.000|TR0|McCain.  I had known him for three 
20101221020430.000|20101221020433.000|TR0|decades, a fellow veteran and all that.  
20101221020433.000|20101221020435.000|TR0|But I thought this was the right choice 
20101221020435.000|20101221020437.000|TR0|and that's the choice that I made.
20101221020437.000|20101221020440.000|TR0|
20101221020440.000|20101221020442.000|TR0|Now, in the almost two years since, I 
20101221020442.000|20101221020444.000|TR0|think the president has done a good job in 
20101221020444.000|20101221020447.000|TR0|stabilizing the economic system.  I mean 
20101221020447.000|20101221020449.000|TR0|Wall Street was collapsing, the whole 
20101221020449.000|20101221020451.000|TR0|economic structure of the country was 
20101221020451.000|20101221020454.000|TR0|falling apart.  And that's been stabilized.
20101221020454.000|20101221020456.000|TR0|
20101221020456.000|20101221020458.000|TR0|I think he's done a good job in moving in 
20101221020458.000|20101221020501.000|TR0|a number of directions with respect to 
20101221020501.000|20101221020503.000|TR0|Iraq and Afghanistan and trying to launch 
20101221020503.000|20101221020505.000|TR0|the Middle East peace process again.
20101221020505.000|20101221020508.000|TR0|
20101221020508.000|20101221020510.000|TR0|But where I think it has not gone as well 
20101221020510.000|20101221020512.000|TR0|and reflected in the late -- the election 
20101221020512.000|20101221020515.000|TR0|just a few days ago was that he has not 
20101221020515.000|20101221020517.000|TR0|communicated to the American people what 
20101221020517.000|20101221020519.000|TR0|we're going to do about getting jobs back 
20101221020519.000|20101221020522.000|TR0|and getting the economic recovery down to 
20101221020522.000|20101221020524.000|TR0|the retail level, where people are still 
20101221020524.000|20101221020526.000|TR0|unemployed.
20101221020526.000|20101221020529.000|TR0|
20101221020529.000|20101221020531.000|TR0|But Wall Street is doing fine.  Wall 
20101221020531.000|20101221020533.000|TR0|Street has got a lot of bonuses still 
20101221020533.000|20101221020536.000|TR0|going out.  But the American people are 
20101221020536.000|20101221020538.000|TR0|losing some focus on President Obama and 
20101221020538.000|20101221020540.000|TR0|what he's trying to do.  And when you look 
20101221020540.000|20101221020543.000|TR0|at the election results, as he said -- I 
20101221020543.000|20101221020545.000|TR0|mean he got shellacked. But I think it was 
20101221020545.000|20101221020547.000|TR0|more than a shellacking, I think it was a 
20101221020547.000|20101221020550.000|TR0|real body blow that he now has to reflect 
20101221020550.000|20101221020552.000|TR0|on and figure out how to come back.
20101221020552.000|20101221020554.000|TR0|
20101221020554.000|20101221020557.000|TR0|KING:  But does it surprise you?  Because 
20101221020557.000|20101221020559.000|TR0|he was such a great campaigner and a mover 
20101221020559.000|20101221020601.000|TR0|of people -- when he spoke, people 
20101221020601.000|20101221020604.000|TR0|listened -- that that perception fades?
20101221020604.000|20101221020606.000|TR0|
20101221020606.000|20101221020608.000|TR0|POWELL:  I'm a little surprised because he 
20101221020608.000|20101221020611.000|TR0|is such a great communicator and he spoke 
20101221020611.000|20101221020613.000|TR0|with a sharpness and a directness that I 
20101221020613.000|20101221020615.000|TR0|think everybody appreciated.  And that's 
20101221020615.000|20101221020618.000|TR0|why he was elected.  But I think a little 
20101221020618.000|20101221020620.000|TR0|of that has been dissipated now.
20101221020620.000|20101221020622.000|TR0|
20101221020622.000|20101221020625.000|TR0|My own view is that he should have focused 
20101221020625.000|20101221020627.000|TR0|on the economy and doing something about 
20101221020627.000|20101221020629.000|TR0|unemployment to the exclusion of almost 
20101221020629.000|20101221020632.000|TR0|everything else domestically.  It's not 
20101221020632.000|20101221020634.000|TR0|that other things aren't important.  
20101221020634.000|20101221020636.000|TR0|Health care is important.  Our energy 
20101221020636.000|20101221020639.000|TR0|policy is important, education policy.  
20101221020639.000|20101221020641.000|TR0|All of this is important.
20101221020641.000|20101221020643.000|TR0|
20101221020643.000|20101221020646.000|TR0|But when you're starting out as the 
20101221020646.000|20101221020648.000|TR0|president, you have to figure out which is 
20101221020648.000|20101221020650.000|TR0|the most important.  In military terms, we 
20101221020650.000|20101221020653.000|TR0|say what's the main attack?  Everything 
20101221020653.000|20101221020655.000|TR0|else is important, but what's the main 
20101221020655.000|20101221020657.000|TR0|attack?
20101221020657.000|20101221020700.000|TR0|
20101221020700.000|20101221020702.000|TR0|And in my judgment, the main attack was to 
20101221020702.000|20101221020704.000|TR0|do something about the jobs situation, the 
20101221020704.000|20101221020707.000|TR0|unemployment situation.  And everywhere I 
20101221020707.000|20101221020709.000|TR0|go in the country, this is what I hear fed 
20101221020709.000|20101221020711.000|TR0|back to me.
20101221020711.000|20101221020714.000|TR0|
20101221020714.000|20101221020716.000|TR0|If I may, Larry, there are other aspects 
20101221020716.000|20101221020718.000|TR0|to that, as well.  The deficit is of deep 
20101221020718.000|20101221020721.000|TR0|concern to the American people, the amount 
20101221020721.000|20101221020723.000|TR0|of debt we're piling on, the national 
20101221020723.000|20101221020725.000|TR0|debt.  And the election results that we 
20101221020725.000|20101221020728.000|TR0|saw were not good for President Obama, not 
20101221020728.000|20101221020730.000|TR0|good for the Democrats.
20101221020730.000|20101221020732.000|TR0|
20101221020732.000|20101221020735.000|TR0|But at the same time, my Republican 
20101221020735.000|20101221020737.000|TR0|friends had better be careful, because I 
20101221020737.000|20101221020739.000|TR0|think the American people were expressing 
20101221020739.000|20101221020742.000|TR0|displeasure with the entire political 
20101221020742.000|20101221020744.000|TR0|system in Washington, D.C.
20101221020744.000|20101221020746.000|TR0|
20101221020746.000|20101221020749.000|TR0|And so the next year, I think, is going to 
20101221020749.000|20101221020751.000|TR0|be very, very important to see how the 
20101221020751.000|20101221020753.000|TR0|Republicans use their majority in the 
20101221020753.000|20101221020756.000|TR0|House, how the Democrats respond with 
20101221020756.000|20101221020758.000|TR0|their majority in the Senate, and how the 
20101221020758.000|20101221020800.000|TR0|president responds as still the president 
20101221020800.000|20101221020803.000|TR0|for the next two plus years.
20101221020803.000|20101221020805.000|TR0|
20101221020805.000|20101221020807.000|TR0|KING:  Governor Rendell, a Democrat of 
20101221020807.000|20101221020810.000|TR0|Pennsylvania, suggested that General 
20101221020810.000|20101221020812.000|TR0|Powell be asked to be the chief of staff.

20101221020831.000|20101221020833.000|TR0|do if asked.  But I don't expect to be 
20101221020833.000|20101221020835.000|TR0|asked because I've had 40 years of 
20101221020835.000|20101221020838.000|TR0|government service so I have no --

20101221020856.000|20101221020859.000|TR0|great chief of staff.

20101221020906.000|20101221020908.000|TR0|POWELL:  Well, he's been running around 
20101221020908.000|20101221020910.000|TR0|throwing my name out. This is the first 
20101221020910.000|20101221020913.000|TR0|chance I've had to suggest that Ed Rendell

20101221020915.000|20101221020917.000|TR0|accomplished governor and mayor of a great

20101221020927.000|20101221020929.000|TR0|country.  In the past, General --

20101221020931.000|20101221020934.000|TR0|POWELL:  I have served my country for 40 
20101221020934.000|20101221020936.000|TR0|years.  And I believe that in my current 
20101221020936.000|20101221020938.000|TR0|life, post-government service, I'm still

20101221020941.000|20101221020943.000|TR0|
20101221020943.000|20101221020945.000|TR0|KING:  You're just back from a major -- 
20101221020945.000|20101221020948.000|TR0|Obama is back from a major trip that 
20101221020948.000|20101221020950.000|TR0|produced mixed results.  What do you make 
20101221020950.000|20101221020952.000|TR0|of that? The eyes -- in the eyes of the 
20101221020952.000|20101221020955.000|TR0|world, he was held above the grain. Now 
20101221020955.000|20101221020957.000|TR0|what?
20101221020957.000|20101221020959.000|TR0|
20101221020959.000|20101221021002.000|TR0|POWELL:  Well, I think it was a trip that 
20101221021002.000|20101221021004.000|TR0|had some successes, but some 
20101221021004.000|20101221021006.000|TR0|disappointments.  He didn't get what he 
20101221021006.000|20101221021009.000|TR0|wanted with respect to a trade agreement 
20101221021009.000|20101221021011.000|TR0|with South Korea.  He wasn't able to 
20101221021011.000|20101221021013.000|TR0|persuade some of his G-20 colleagues of 
20101221021013.000|20101221021016.000|TR0|the direction to move with respect to the 
20101221021016.000|20101221021018.000|TR0|financial situation.
20101221021018.000|20101221021020.000|TR0|
20101221021020.000|20101221021023.000|TR0|He didn't get what he was looking for with 
20101221021023.000|20101221021025.000|TR0|respect to trade policy changes.  But at 
20101221021025.000|20101221021027.000|TR0|the same time, I think one of the great 
20101221021027.000|20101221021030.000|TR0|achievements of the trip is that he showed 
20101221021030.000|20101221021032.000|TR0|that America still recognizes that it is 
20101221021032.000|20101221021034.000|TR0|an Asian Pacific power.
20101221021034.000|20101221021037.000|TR0|

20101221021039.000|20101221021041.000|TR0|the importance of China these days, I 
20101221021041.000|20101221021044.000|TR0|think he set the right message that as you

20101221022046.000|20101221022048.000|TR0|But I cannot tell how firm that is and how 
20101221022048.000|20101221022051.000|TR0|real it is and whether it will still be 
20101221022051.000|20101221022053.000|TR0|there a couple of years from now.  It 
20101221022053.000|20101221022055.000|TR0|really is going to require -- the only 
20101221022055.000|20101221022058.000|TR0|answer to this is for us to do the best we

20101221024200.000|20101221024203.000|TR0|
20101221024203.000|20101221024205.000|TR0|Waterboarding -- the president kind of 
20101221024205.000|20101221024207.000|TR0|defends it, I guess, in the book.
20101221024207.000|20101221024210.000|TR0|
20101221024210.000|20101221024212.000|TR0|Do you?
20101221024212.000|20101221024214.000|TR0|
20101221024214.000|20101221024217.000|TR0|POWELL:  You know, when we were going 
20101221024217.000|20101221024219.000|TR0|through this, America had just been struck 
20101221024219.000|20101221024221.000|TR0|and we were trying to make sure we were 
20101221024221.000|20101221024224.000|TR0|protecting the American people in every 
20101221024224.000|20101221024226.000|TR0|way possible.  And the intelligence 
20101221024226.000|20101221024228.000|TR0|agencies came forward with some procedures 
20101221024228.000|20101221024231.000|TR0|they wished to use to get as much 
20101221024231.000|20101221024233.000|TR0|information as they can.  And we all 
20101221024233.000|20101221024235.000|TR0|talked about these.  And we were concerned 
20101221024235.000|20101221024238.000|TR0|about the fact that, you know, we had 
20101221024238.000|20101221024240.000|TR0|responsibilities under international law.
20101221024240.000|20101221024242.000|TR0|
20101221024242.000|20101221024245.000|TR0|And I think all of us felt that 
20101221024245.000|20101221024247.000|TR0|waterboarding was if not over the line, 
20101221024247.000|20101221024249.000|TR0|very close to the line.  But the president 
20101221024249.000|20101221024252.000|TR0|of the United States, who has a 
20101221024252.000|20101221024254.000|TR0|responsibility to protect the American 
20101221024254.000|20101221024256.000|TR0|citizens, felt that in that circumstance, 
20101221024256.000|20101221024259.000|TR0|waterboarding was appropriate.  And as he 
20101221024259.000|20101221024301.000|TR0|clearly said, he approved it and takes 
20101221024301.000|20101221024303.000|TR0|responsibility for the approval of it.
20101221024303.000|20101221024306.000|TR0|
20101221024306.000|20101221024308.000|TR0|I think subsequently, as you kind of go 
20101221024308.000|20101221024310.000|TR0|down the years and take a look at what has 
20101221024310.000|20101221024313.000|TR0|happened over the years, I think it can be 
20101221024313.000|20101221024315.000|TR0|called now torture.  You'll know that the 
20101221024315.000|20101221024317.000|TR0|CIA stopped doing it.  And there was a 
20101221024317.000|20101221024320.000|TR0|school of thought within the FBI and 
20101221024320.000|20101221024322.000|TR0|elsewhere that you don't really get good 
20101221024322.000|20101221024324.000|TR0|information from this kind of thing.  You 
20101221024324.000|20101221024327.000|TR0|can get it through more vigorous and 
20101221024327.000|20101221024329.000|TR0|professional interrogation.
20101221024329.000|20101221024331.000|TR0|
20101221024331.000|20101221024334.000|TR0|But the president of the United States is 
20101221024334.000|20101221024336.000|TR0|the one who has the responsibility for our 
20101221024336.000|20101221024338.000|TR0|safety.  And at that time, the one thing

20101221024341.000|20101221024343.000|TR0|sure that we were getting everything we 
20101221024343.000|20101221024345.000|TR0|needed to prevent another 9/11 attack.  
20101221024345.000|20101221024348.000|TR0|It's easy...
20101221024348.000|20101221024350.000|TR0|
